description: Congestion measurements are defined by travel-time delay, which is the difference between the travel time on highways at the free flow speed and the time spent in current traffic. In 2012, the average travel-time delay on all congested corridors was 17.2 minutes per traveler, per day. A highway is considered congested when the peak traffic volume is 85 percent or greater than what the highway was designed to sustain.

name: Travel Delays In Congested Highway Segments
